entry.content:
So, now I am officially a maintainer of the algorithms package, which makes me quite happy. Many thanks go to the previous maintainer, Peter Williams, for creating such a great piece of software.

Also, it seems that finally Adobe has understood that the scientific community uses Unix and they have released Acrobat/Adobe Reader 7.0 for Linux, with widgets with Gtk 2.0. Trés cool.

BTW, I have stopped reading on Graph Theory just for a tiny bit to learn things on Abstract Algebra. I want to study algebraic properties of graphs and, for that, I have to get my rusty algebra in shape. Also, some Linear Algebra wouldn't hurt.
